MainPage.Take these: Take these 3 easy steps to get eSIM on your phone!

1.title: Choose eSIM Data Plan
1.text: Pick an eSIM data plan that suits your needs. Stay connected with the entire world, anytime, anywhere.

2.title: Easy Installation of eSIM
2.text: Follow our simple step-by-step guide and scan the QR code for digital installation.

3.title: Easy Activation of eSIM
3.text: Follow our simple step-by-step guide for digital activation.

4.title: Enjoy Your Connection
4.text: Your eSIM is now activated! Enjoy seamless connectivity anywhere in the world.

select.local: Select a country to purchase an eSIM
select.regional: Select a region to purchase an eSIM

1.question: Which devices and software versions support eSIM?
1.answer:
- **iOS:** You must have iOS 12.1 or later and an unlocked iPhone. iPhones older than XR or XS support eSIM.
(Note: If you purchased your phone under a contract, check with your carrier to unlock eSIM compatibility.)
- **Android:** Samsung, Pixel, and many Android devices support eSIM.

2.question: In what scenarios can eSIM service be used?
2.answer:
- Add a local data plan when traveling internationally.
- Use eSIM for data while keeping your primary SIM for voice and SMS.

3.question: How to set up eSIM for iOS/Android?
3.answer:
- Purchase an eSIM data plan on our website.
- Receive the eSIM QR code by email.
- Follow instructions in our Help Center->Guides

4.question: How fast is the network speed?
4.answer: 4G/LTE service is available in most countries, in some countries 5G is also available.

5.question: Are voice calls and SMS included?

6.question: Can I use more than one eSIM provider when traveling abroad?
6.answer: Yes, iPhones can store 10 eSIMs, and Androids can store 5-7 eSIMs. Only one eSIM can be active at a time. Label eSIMs to avoid confusion.

7.question: How to use hotspots with eSIM?
7.answer: On iOS, APNs are preconfigured except for Japan (set APN to be “vmobile.jp”). For Android issues, contact customer service for support.

8.question: How to use dual SIM on iPhone and set up eSIM?
8.answer: Dual SIM offers separate voice/SMS and data plans. Follow specific iPhone steps to configure eSIM for cellular data only.

9.question: Should I switch on Data Roaming when using eSIM?
9.answer: Yes. Ensure that "Data Roaming" is turned ON during use.

10.question: How to remove the eSIM data plan after use?
10.answer: Use your phone's delete eSIM function in settings.

11.question: How do I get my eSIM after payment?
11.answer: You will receive an email with your QR code. Check your spam folder if it doesn't arrive within a minute.

12.question: How is the validity period of the plan calculated?
12.answer: Validity starts from your eSIM's first connection, as described in the package information.

13.question: When does the billing period or validity start?
13.answer: Data plans will only begin counting usage once customers make their first connection to the local network.

14.question: How to check the balance of remaining data?
14.answer: Check "My eSIMs" tab in our mini app or telegram bot.

15.question: How to Top Up a data plan?
15.answer: Top Up is available in My eSIMs tab.

16.question: How do I refund an unused order?
16.answer: In My eSIMs tab, you can use the Cancel feature to refund an unused (not installed) eSIM order.

17.question: What does each eSIM status mean?
17.answer:
Here are the eSIM status and their definitions:
- Provisioning - Newly purchased eSIM being created by the server.
- New - Newly created eSIM, ready for installation.
- Onboard - Newly installed eSIM, waiting for first use, no data use.
- In Use - Installed eSIM serving data from a data plan.
- Depleted - Installed eSIM having consumed available data.
- Canceled - Newly purchased eSIM, refunded and returned to inventory.
- Deleted - eSIM uninstalled from user device or revoked/invalid eSIM.
- Suspended - Installed eSIM currently disabled.

18.question: Can I use one eSIM for two devices?
18.answer: No, an eSIM can only be used on one device at a time. If you want to use eSIM services on another device, you will need to transfer the eSIM.

19.question: If I lost my eSIM QR code, what can I do?
19.answer: Check your email or contact support.

20.question: Will my physical SIM still work while eSIM is installed?
20.answer: Yes, your physical SIM will still work. Turn off data roaming for it and enable "WiFi calling."

21.question: What devices are supported?
21.answer: eSIM is compatible with a wide range of devices that support eSIM technology. For a detailed list of supported devices, please visit our Help Center->Supported Devices.

22.question: Can I reuse an eSIM?
22.answer: Your eSIM won't be available to transfer if you have already activated. You could still enjoy eSIM if you haven't activated it before changing the device.

23.question: How do I transfer an eSIM to another device?
23.answer:
You can transfer your not activated eSIM to another device.
To transfer:
- Remove the eSIM from the current device (uninstall or delete from settings).
- Use the same QR code or activation method on the new device.
- Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the setup on the new device.

24.question: What if I erased my eSIM plan by accident?
24.answer:
DO NOT delete your eSIM when you haven't used up your data.
- Try to reinstall from the original QR code.
- If you accidentally delete your eSIM after your activation, you may have to purchase a new eSIM.
